did.unittitle: Edgar Roscoe Cumings Published Research Media Materials
did.abstract: Edgar Roscoe Cumings was a long-time chair of the Geology Department of Indiana University from 1904 to 1942. Cumings notably led work on the Cincinnatian (Late Ordovician) of Indiana, the Silurian reefs in the northern part of the state, and on the fauna of the Salem Limestone.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research. Advance notice required.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Edgar Roscoe Cumings was a long-time chair of the Geology Department of Indiana University from 1904 to 1942. He arrived at IU in 1898, after doing graduate work at Cornell University in Ithaca, New York. He later took a leave of absence to obtain his Ph.D. from Yale University in 1903. He and his students studied the paleontology of Indiana and began building the IU Paleontology Collection in earnest. Cumings notably led work on the Cincinnatian (Late Ordovician) of Indiana, the Silurian reefs in the northern part of the state, and on the fauna of the Salem Limestone. Cumings was originally from Ohio and was married to Frances L. Cumings, originally of Pennsylvania. They had two children, Edith K. and Edgar C. Cumings.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection was arranged according to author's organization.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Negatives, 1908, consists of Cumings' glass negatives for publication of The Stratigraphy and Paleontology of the Cincinnati Series of Indiana.

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: Photocopying permitted only with permission of the Curator(s) or Collections Manager of the Paleontology Collection.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Edgar Roscoe Cumings Published Research Media Materials, IU Paleontology Collection

did.unittitle: Located in Cabinet EF Tray8 - Glass negatives for publication
